1:
The proverbs of Solomon son of David, the king of Israel.
\q
2:
These proverbs are to teach wisdom and instruction,
\q to teach words of insight,
\q
3:
that you may receive instruction in order to live
\q by doing what is right, just, and fair.
4:
These proverbs are also to give wisdom to the naive,
\q and to give knowledge and discretion to young people.
\q
5:
Let wise people listen and increase their learning,
\q and let discerning people get guidance,
\q
6:
to understand proverbs, sayings,
\q and words of wise people and their riddles.
7:
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge—
\q fools despise wisdom and instruction.
\q
9:
they will be a graceful wreath for your head
\q and pendants hanging from your neck.
10:
My son, if sinners try to entice you into their sin,
\q refuse to follow them.
\q
11:
If they say, "Come with us,
\q let us lie in wait to commit murder,
\q let us hide and attack innocent people for no reason.
12:
Let us swallow them up alive, like Sheol takes away those who are healthy,
\q and make them like those who fall into the pit.
\q
14:
Throw in your lot with us;
\q we will all have one purse together."
16:
their feet run to evil
\q and they hurry to shed blood.
\q
17:
For it is useless to spread the net to trap a bird
\q while the bird is watching.
18:
These men lie in wait to kill themselves—
\q they set a trap for themselves.
\q
19:
So are the ways of everyone who gains riches by injustice;
\q unjust gain takes away the lives of those who hold on to it.
21:
at the head of the noisy streets she cries out,
\q at the entrance of the city gates she speaks,
\q
22:
"How long, you naive people, will you love being naive?
\q How long, you mockers, will you delight in mockery,
\q and how long, you fools, will you hate knowledge?
25:
But you have ignored all my instruction
\q and paid no attention to my correction.
26:
I will laugh at your calamity,
\q I will mock you when the terror comes—
\q
27:
when your fearful dread comes like a storm
\q and disaster sweeps over you like a whirlwind,
\q when distress and anguish come upon you.
29:
Because they hate knowledge
\q and did not choose the fear of Yahweh,
\q
30:
they would not follow my instruction,
\q and they despised all my correction.
31:
They will eat the fruit of their ways,
\q and with the fruit of their schemes they will be filled.
\q
32:
For the naive are killed when they turn away,
\q and the indifference of fools will destroy them.
\q
33:
But whoever listens to me will live in safety
\q and will rest secure with no fear of disaster."
